alert.note: Alert for Craig; Ottawa; Rogers (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 3:50PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Craig, northeastern Rogers and northern Ottawa Counties through 430 PM CST... At 349 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles west of White Oak, moving northeast at 55 mph. Locally heavy rainfall is also occurring with this cell. Minor low land flooding of poor drainage areas will be possible. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Miami... Vinita... Baxter Springs... Commerce... Chelsea... Quapaw... Welch... Bluejacket... Treece... Picher... White Oak... Narcissa... Cardin... Hollow... Centrailia... Pyramid Corners... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 305 and 318, and between mile markers 322 and 324. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
